content: @rylev I plan to do triage in several hours today
ok, going to try to get this done now, but had to do some other stuff for a bit so have less time than I'd hoped.

@rylev as a heads up, adjusted triage script to silence changes less than 2% (in either direction) on the coercions incr-patched runs. Graphs show regular variability up to 2% there, it doesn't seem worth flagging them (e.g., this weeks report went from 13 entries to 1)

simulacrum said:

rylev as a heads up, adjusted triage script to silence changes less than 2% (in either direction) on the coercions incr-patched runs. Graphs show regular variability up to 2% there, it doesn't seem worth flagging them (e.g., this weeks report went from 13 entries to 1)

IIUC this also means that the weekly triage reports will be shorter than before, right? I'd add a short note about this in the compiler agenda (to explicit why reports will be shorter from now on) - makes sense?
Eh, not really - I at least filtered those out manually pretty much always, so speeds up process likely, but not a fundamental change in output
ah ok understood :thumbs_up:
